tiled.io
Interface PluggableMapIO

All Known Subinterfaces:
MapReader, MapWriter
All Known Implementing Classes:
JSONMapWriter, LuaMapWriter, MappyMapReader, MappyMapWriter, RXDataReader, RXDataWriter, TiledPlugin, TMWServerMapWriter, XMLMapTransformer, XMLMapWriter
public interface PluggableMapIO

This is the interface for all Tiled I/O plugins, whether they load, save, or both. The PluginClassLoader also uses this to check the supported file extensions.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getDescription()
          Returns a long description (no limit) that details the plugin's capabilities, author, contact info, etc.
 java.lang.String getFilter()
          Lists supported file extensions.
 java.lang.String getName()
          Returns a short description of the plugin, or the plugin name.
 java.lang.String getPluginPackage()
          Returns the base Java package string for the plugin
 void setLogger(PluginLogger logger)
          The PluginLogger object passed by the editor when the plugin is called to load or save a map can be used by the plugin to notify the user of any problems or messages.
 

Method Detail

getFilter

java.lang.String getFilter()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Lists supported file extensions. This function is used by the editor to find the plugin to use for a specific file extension.

Returns:
a comma delimited string of supported file extensions
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns a short description of the plugin, or the plugin name. This string is displayed in the list of loaded plugins under the Help menu in Tiled.

Returns:
a short name or description

getDescription

java.lang.String getDescription()
Returns a long description (no limit) that details the plugin's capabilities, author, contact info, etc.

Returns:
a long description of the plugin

getPluginPackage

java.lang.String getPluginPackage()
Returns the base Java package string for the plugin

Returns:
String the base package of the plugin

setLogger

void setLogger(PluginLogger logger)
The PluginLogger object passed by the editor when the plugin is called to load or save a map can be used by the plugin to notify the user of any problems or messages.

Parameters:
logger -
